definitions: adhering or attached firmly to a surface through adhesion or friction
extending or projecting beyond a normal boundary or surface level
examples: The sticking bandage wouldn't come off easily
He noticed sticking residue on the glass surface
The sticking nail caught her sweater sleeve
There were sticking branches along the narrow path

definitions: having a viscous or adhesive quality that makes things adhere to it
unpleasantly warm and humid, causing perspiration and discomfort throughout
awkward, difficult or embarrassing to handle or resolve in social contexts
examples: Her hands felt sticky after eating the candy
The sticky tape held the poster firmly in place
The sticky weather made everyone feel uncomfortable
It was a sticky summer afternoon in the city
They found themselves in a sticky situation at work
The negotiations reached a sticky point over salaries

definitions: not easily bent or changed in shape; rigid and firm to touch
painful and difficult to move due to injury, cold or lack of use
formal, reserved and unfriendly in manner or behavior toward others
severe, harsh or difficult, especially regarding penalties, competition or challenges
strong in alcoholic content or concentration of ingredients in drinks
examples: The stiff cardboard wouldn't bend without creasing
She wore a stiff collar that looked uncomfortable
His stiff muscles ached after the long run
My neck feels stiff from sleeping awkwardly
The stiff reception made everyone feel unwelcome
His stiff manner put the guests on edge
They faced stiff competition from rival companies
The judge imposed a stiff penalty for fraud
He ordered a stiff drink after the meeting
The bartender mixed a stiff cocktail for him

definitions: held back, suppressed or prevented from natural expression or development
made to feel unable to breathe freely due to lack of air
examples: Her stifled creativity finally found an outlet
The stifled laughter could be heard from outside
The stifled atmosphere in the room was oppressive
He felt stifled by the lack of ventilation

definitions: extremely hot and airless in a way that makes breathing difficult
preventing freedom, development or natural expression through excessive restriction or control
examples: The stifling heat made everyone seek shade desperately
Working in the stifling warehouse was nearly unbearable
The stifling regulations prevented any creative innovation
She found the stifling atmosphere at home unbearable

definitions: born dead; having died in the womb before or during birth
failing completely before having a chance to develop or succeed properly
examples: The stillborn infant was a tragedy for the family
Medical advances have reduced stillborn birth rates significantly
Their stillborn project never got off the ground
The stillborn negotiations ended before they properly began

definitions: stiff and unnatural in manner of expression, lacking spontaneity or ease
raised or supported on stilts or posts above ground or water level
examples: His stilted conversation made everyone feel uncomfortable
The stilted dialogue ruined the otherwise good play
The stilted houses protected residents from flooding
They lived in stilted cabins along the riverbank

definitions: having the property of temporarily increasing physiological or nervous activity in the body
examples: The stimulant effects of caffeine last several hours
Some medications have stimulant properties that affect sleep

definitions: made more active, excited or interested through external influence or encouragement
prompted or encouraged to increased activity, growth or development through specific intervention
examples: The stimulated audience responded with enthusiastic applause
She felt stimulated by the challenging discussion
The stimulated economy showed signs of rapid growth
Stimulated neurons fired more frequently in the experiment

definitions: encouraging interest, enthusiasm and mental activity through intellectual or creative challenge
causing increased physiological activity or alertness in body systems or functions
examples: The stimulating lecture sparked many new ideas
She found the stimulating conversation thoroughly enjoyable
The stimulating massage increased blood circulation significantly
Coffee has stimulating effects on the nervous system

definitions: causing a sharp, burning pain like that from an insect sting
sharply critical or hurtful in words or manner toward someone
examples: The stinging nettle left red marks on her skin
Stinging rain pelted against their faces
His stinging criticism hurt more than he realized
She delivered a stinging rebuke to the committee

definitions: unwilling to give or spend money; ungenerous with resources or possessions
providing less than is needed or expected; meager or inadequate in quantity
examples: Her stingy uncle never gave birthday presents
Don't be so stingy with the chocolate sauce
The restaurant served stingy portions for the price
The stingy salary barely covered living expenses

definitions: producing or emitting a strong, offensive smell that causes discomfort
extremely unpleasant, objectionable or of very poor quality in nature
examples: The stinking garbage needed immediate removal
A stinking pile of rotting fish filled the alley
What a stinking attitude he has today
The whole situation is a stinking mess

definitions: having an unpleasant smell; malodorous or offensive to the nose
examples: The stinky cheese was an acquired taste
His stinky socks needed immediate washing

definitions: emotionally affected or moved by something; experiencing heightened feelings
mixed or agitated by circular motion; having been physically disturbed
examples: The stirred crowd erupted in spontaneous applause
She felt deeply stirred by the memorial service
The stirred paint showed swirls of different colors
Keep the stirred mixture at low heat

definitions: causing strong emotions or excitement; rousing feelings of enthusiasm or passion
beginning to move, wake or show signs of activity after being still
examples: The stirring speech motivated everyone to action
It was a stirring performance of the national anthem
The stirring breeze rustled through the leaves
There were stirring signs of spring everywhere

definitions: joined, fastened or decorated with stitches using thread or similar material
examples: The stitched leather wallet was beautifully crafted
Her stitched wound healed without complications

definitions: commonly used and not original; standard or conventional in nature
regularly kept in inventory for sale or use; readily available
examples: He gave the same stock answer to every question
The stock phrases in his speech were predictable
We only carry stock sizes in this style
These are stock items available for immediate delivery

definitions: supplied or filled with goods, provisions or inventory for use or sale
deliberately populated with fish for recreational fishing or conservation purposes
examples: The well stocked pantry had everything they needed
Their stocked warehouse could fulfill any order
The stocked pond attracted many weekend fishermen
Recently stocked lakes provide excellent fishing opportunities

definitions: having a short, broad and solidly built body structure; thickset
examples: The stocky wrestler had a low center of gravity
His stocky build made him perfect for rugby

definitions: showing little emotion and accepting difficulties without complaint or visible distress
examples: His stoic response to the bad news surprised everyone
She maintained a stoic expression throughout the trial

definitions: made from or consisting of rock material; constructed using stone
examples: The stone walls had stood for centuries
They lived in a beautiful stone cottage

definitions: under the influence of drugs, especially marijuana; in an intoxicated state
having had the stones or pits removed from fruit before processing
examples: The stoned teenager couldn't focus on the conversation
He was too stoned to drive home safely
Buy stoned olives for the recipe
The stoned cherries were ready for the pie

definitions: covered with or containing many stones; rocky and hard in composition
showing no emotion or sympathy; cold and unresponsive in manner
examples: The stony path hurt their feet through thin shoes
Crops wouldn't grow in the stony soil
Her stony silence made him even more nervous
He met their pleas with a stony expression

definitions: brought to a halt; no longer moving or continuing in action
examples: The stopped clock showed the wrong time
Traffic remained stopped for over an hour

definitions: having a specified number of floors or levels in a building structure
examples: The three storeyed house overlooked the park
Multi storeyed car parks are common in cities

definitions: having the stated number of floors or levels in building construction
celebrated in story or history; having a distinguished and notable past
examples: The five storied pagoda attracted many tourists
They lived in a two storied colonial house
The storied institution celebrated its bicentennial anniversary
He played for the storied Yankees franchise

definitions: characterized by storms with strong winds, rain and unsettled weather conditions
marked by turmoil, conflict or passionate disagreement; emotionally turbulent
examples: The stormy weather kept all boats in harbor
It was a dark and stormy night
Their stormy relationship finally ended in divorce
The meeting turned into a stormy debate

definitions: having a heavy, solid build; somewhat fat but strong in appearance
brave, bold and determined in facing challenges or difficulties courageously
strong and thick in construction; able to withstand stress or pressure
examples: The stout gentleman needed a larger chair
Her stout figure filled the doorway completely
The stout defenders held their position all day
She put up a stout resistance to the changes
We need stout rope for this heavy load
The stout wooden door withstood the battering

definitions: growing or spreading in an irregular, untidy way without clear organization
examples: The straggling vines covered the old fence
A straggling line of refugees crossed the border

definitions: extending in a straight line without curves or bends; direct
examples: The straightaway section of track allowed maximum speed
They had a straightaway view to the ocean

definitions: easy to understand or do; presenting no difficulties or complications
honest and frank in manner or speech; not evasive or deceiving
examples: The instructions were straightforward and easy to follow
It's a straightforward process with no hidden steps
I appreciate your straightforward answer to my question
She's straightforward about her opinions and feelings

definitions: showing signs of nervous tension, anxiety or stress from pressure
not natural or genuine; forced and awkward in manner or expression
having been passed through a strainer to remove solid particles
examples: Their strained relationship was obvious to everyone
She gave him a strained smile
The strained conversation made everyone uncomfortable
His strained jokes fell flat
Add the strained tomatoes to the sauce
Use strained yogurt for this recipe

definitions: requiring or showing great effort or exertion; pushing to the limits
examples: The straining rope finally snapped under pressure
His straining muscles showed the effort required

definitions: narrow or restricted in space or scope; having little room
examples: They found themselves in strait circumstances financially
The strait passage allowed only single file

definitions: left without means of leaving a place; abandoned in a difficult position
examples: The stranded tourists waited for rescue
We were stranded when our car broke down

definitions: unusual, surprising or difficult to understand; not normal or expected
not previously known, seen or experienced; unfamiliar and foreign
examples: That's a strange way to solve the problem
She heard strange noises coming from the attic
I felt uncomfortable in the strange surroundings
It's strange being in a foreign country

definitions: suppressed, restricted or prevented from natural expression or development
killed or rendered unconscious by compression of the throat
examples: Her strangled cry barely escaped her lips
The strangled economy couldn't grow
The strangled victim was found in the park
Police investigated the strangled businessman's death

definitions: tall, strong and healthy looking; having a robust physical build
examples: The strapping young man easily lifted the boxes
She was a strapping woman who worked the farm

definitions: carefully designed or planned to serve a particular purpose or advantage
relating to military strategy or having military importance for defense
examples: They made strategic investments in emerging markets
The company's strategic planning improved its position
The strategic location controlled the mountain pass
Strategic weapons were deployed along the border

definitions: arranged in distinct layers or levels, especially in social or geological contexts
examples: The stratified rock formation showed millions of years
Their stratified society had rigid class boundaries

definitions: made from dried stalks of grain plants used for various purposes
having a pale yellow color resembling dried straw
examples: The straw hat protected her from the sun
They slept on straw mattresses
Her straw colored hair gleamed in sunlight
He wore a straw colored linen suit

definitions: having wandered away from the intended path or group; lost
occurring randomly or occasionally; not part of the main group
examples: A stray dog followed them home from school
The stray sheep was returned to the flock
A stray bullet shattered the window
She found a few stray coins under the cushions

definitions: moving away from the correct path, topic or acceptable behavior
examples: His straying attention made learning difficult
The straying cattle damaged neighboring crops

definitions: marked with long thin lines or bands of contrasting color or texture
examples: Her streaked hair looked professionally highlighted
The streaked windows needed thorough cleaning

definitions: having streaks or uneven lines of different color or texture
varying in quality or performance; inconsistent and unpredictable
examples: The streaky bacon sizzled in the pan
The streaky paint job needed redoing
His streaky performance frustrated the coach
The team's streaky play cost them the championship

definitions: flowing steadily and continuously in a current or stream
transmitted continuously over the internet as audio or video content
examples: Streaming water poured from the broken pipe
Her streaming tears showed her deep sorrow
The streaming service offers thousands of movies
Streaming video requires fast internet connection

definitions: having a smooth shape that reduces resistance when moving through air or water
made more efficient by simplifying or eliminating unnecessary elements
examples: The streamlined car design improved fuel efficiency
Dolphins have streamlined bodies for swimming
The streamlined process saved hours of work
Their streamlined operations increased profitability significantly

definitions: having the knowledge and experience needed to deal with the dangers of city life
examples: The streetwise teenager knew which areas to avoid
You need to be streetwise to survive here

definitions: made stronger or more powerful in physical structure or abstract quality
examples: The strengthened walls could withstand earthquakes
Their strengthened relationship survived the crisis
